brief_summary.textblock:
Vocal stimulation may encourage spontaneous breathing in patients dependent on mechanical
      ventilation.

      The study will include 30 patients on mechanical ventilation that will be intervened by the
      vocal stimulation and 30 patients on mechanical ventilation will serve as the control group.

clinical_study.brief_title: Can a Vocal Stimulus Provoke Spontaneous Breathing in an Ischemic Stroke Patient Dependent on Mechanical Ventilation?
clinical_study.condition: Patients Ventilated by Mechanical Ventilation With Ischemic Stroke

detailed_description.textblock:
Vocal stimulation may encourage  breathing in ventilated patients dependent on mechanical
      ventilation.

      The study will include 30 patients on mechanical ventilation that will be intervened by the
      vocal stimulation and 30 patients on mechanical ventilation that will be our control group.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  ischemic stroke men and women older than 18 years old and younger than 80 years old

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  coma from other reasons other than ischemic stroke hemmorhagic stroke active
             malignancy renal failure

clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1 - Vocal Stimuli to Provoke Spontaneous Breathing

oversight_info.authority: Israel: Internal Review Board of the Baruch Padeh Poria Medical Center

primary_outcome.description: we anticipate a better response and recurring spontaneous breathing in the treatment group.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The Baruch Padeh Medical Center, Poriya
responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of an Internal Medicine Department

clinical_study.source: The Baruch Padeh Medical Center, Poriya

lead_sponsor.agency: The Baruch Padeh Medical Center, Poriya

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
